summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 discussing the maximum potential sentence Ghislaine Maxwell faced following her arrest. It includes a forwarded question about why she faced up to 35 years instead of life for a charge under 18 U.S. Code ยง 2423, and an explanation that the sentencing maximums are based on the law at the time of the alleged offenses (1994-1997). The chain also references a press conference announcing her charges.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain, discussing the maximum sentence she faces for charges related to the sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly played a role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls.

persons.name: CAL
persons.context: The individual who initially asked the question about the discrepancy in Ghislaine Maxwell's maximum potential sentence.

persons.name: AFP
persons.context: The individual forwarding the question about Maxwell's sentence and asking a separate question about the number of years of jail time she risks.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Press Conference Announcing Charges
events.description: A press conference was held by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to announce charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Alleged Offense Period
events.description: The time period for the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell, which influences the applicable maximum sentences.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document clarifies that Ghislaine Maxwell faced up to 35 years imprisonment, not life, because the maximum sentences for the charged offenses were based on the law as it existed during the alleged crime period of 1994-1997.
One of the charges against Maxwell was under 18 U.S. Code ยง 2423 (Transportation of minors), which currently carries a maximum sentence of life, but the older statute applied.
A press conference to announce the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for July 2, 2020, at 12:00 p.m.
The charges relate to Maxwell's alleged role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.
